rob_notes: Small pilot; crossover with potential carryover; assessor blinded; treatment vs control both active lighting modifications; outcome subset n=18 for PVT.
N=2; no counterbalancing; no washout; subjective outcomes prominent; objective PVT only for one case beyond baseline.
Open-label; workplace feasibility limited adherence; PVT subset only; crossover period effects possible.
Very small N=6; multiple components; potential contamination; but double-blind with active placebo and washout described.
Crossover without washout; outcomes include self-report and app-based PVT; adjustment for sleep duration/light exposure reported.
Original study randomized control vs intervention, but this paperâ€™s primary comparisons are adapted vs non-adapted (post hoc grouping); small sample; 2 participants contributed to both conditions.
Not blinded; sleep extension adherence encouraged but self-managed; outcomes measured at fixed times (Mon/Thu); crossover order counterbalanced.
Crossover across 3 work periods; capsule arms double-blind (placebo/melatonin) but bright light not blinded; potential period effects; some missing data imputed; small N.
Unblinded pre/post caffeine challenge; no placebo; self-reported intake and adherence; possible practice/expectancy and regression to mean.
Double-blind crossover; small n=12; potential residual withdrawal/expectancy effects; outcomes mostly physiologic.
Double-blind crossover with placebo and withdrawal; single-sex sample; preprint (not peer reviewed); one participant excluded for incompliance.
Crossover; lighting conditions not blinded; missing DLMO data for many; multiple outcomes/timepoints; lab protocol strong.
Parallel-group randomization; masking imperfect due to lens tint; attrition higher in BLB group; outcomes objective but multiple comparisons.

Non-randomized ward comparison with preset rotation schedule; partial crossover (only subset observed under both environments); self-report outcomes; potential period/time confounding and selection (29% participation).

Randomized crossover with strong lab control but very small n=7 (after exclusions); fixed task order; multiple outcomes/timepoints; potential carryover/period effects across 3-8 week gap unlikely but not fully addressed.
Field RCT with active control and baseline period; outcomes largely self-report (errors/fatigue/sleepiness); partial blinding; intervention multi-component; preprint (not peer reviewed).
Parallel RCT in HD patients; blinding unlikely; small sample; objective TAP outcomes but multiple comparisons and potential adherence-related missingness.

Sequential pre-post control-trial (no randomization; time confounding across training blocks + maintenance period); outcomes partly objective (PVT) but measured at limited timepoints; potential maturation/training effects.

Stratified random assignment to retreat vs waitlist, but blinding not possible; task difficulty procedure changed after preassessment; long-term follow-up relies on self-reported practice and has attrition.
Single-arm pre/post with no control; attendance is both exposure and confounder; potential regression to mean, time trends, and placebo/motivation effects.
Within-subject crossover with fixed order (pre/during/post Ramadan); potential period/training effects and expectancy; objective sleep monitored but no blinding.
Small n=10; order/carryover not clearly reported; objective EEG outcome; short training period; no behavioral cognitive outcomes.
Within-subject longitudinal sleep restriction in natural conditions; compliance exclusions; no parallel control group; outcomes objective but time trends/learning may contribute.
Random assignment to extended vs habitual sleep; in-lab protocol but small n=24; missing sessions due to technical issues; one-tailed p-values; outcomes modeled longitudinally.
Single-group repeated-measures confinement exposure with no parallel control; strong time/learning confounding (practice effect noted); outcomes largely within-person trends.
Single-arm pre/post (no control); potential time and expectancy effects; subjective outcomes (fatigue/mood) and limited sleepiness sampling (3 timepoints on last day).

Replication study randomized operators to training vs control but small final n=16 with attrition; blinding unlikely; multiple cognitive outcomes; paper reports pilot + replication in a single article.
Single-arm pre/post thesis; no control group; adherence gap (target +60 min sleep, achieved +22 min); outcomes measured at two timepoints; multiple comparisons/Bonferroni.
Single-group pre/post with long (6-month) follow-up; self-selection into seminar and large attrition to follow-up; self-report outcomes only; no parallel control.
Two crossover field studies in rotating shift workers; extracted from OpenAlex abstract only because full text is paywalled; insufficient details for RoB assessment.
